meanings.sent1: Her vatic dreams often foretold future events.
meanings.sent2: The old man's vatic words seemed to hold a mysterious power.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vatic behavior of hiding before a storm amused the family.
meanings.sent4: The vatic aura surrounding the ancient tree made it seem almost magical.
meanings.sent5: The vatic prophecy of the wise woman echoed through the village.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a prophet
meanings.sent1: The vatic scrolls found in the temple revealed ancient truths.
meanings.sent2: In the museum, there were artifacts depicting vatic symbols.
meanings.sent3: The vatic robe worn by the actor in the play added an air of mystery.
meanings.sent4: The vatic connection between the two characters was evident to all.
meanings.sent5: The vatic chants of the monks filled the temple with solemnity.

meanings.sent1: His vatic gaze seemed to pierce through the veil of time.
meanings.sent2: The vatic voice of the speaker resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The vatic hat worn by the child for fun sparked laughter.
meanings.sent4: The vatic presence of the stranger made the townspeople uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The vatic wisdom of the elder was sought by all in the village.
